subject: Programming
title: When Rules Should Be Broken
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: When Rules Should Be Broken.

hook.text: Every principle in this course has exceptions. Blindly following rules creates its own mess.

buildup.text: DRY can create coupling. YAGNI can prevent necessary preparation. SRP can over-fragment code.

discovery.text: Principles are guides, not laws. The context ‚Äî team size, deadline, system age ‚Äî determines the choice.

twist.text: Dogmatic developers cause as much damage as careless ones. Rigid rules ignore real tradeoffs.

climax.text: Wisdom is knowing which rule to apply, which to bend, and which to ignore ‚Äî right now.

punchline.text: Know the rules well enough to know when to break them.

quiz.question: When should clean code principles be broken?
options: When context and tradeoffs demand it
